result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Allen Capelle Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Capelle Jr.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Richard Allen Capelle in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, and wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NOT GUILTY on behalf of DE to Count 1.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
